thesis:
The thesis is a two-signal regime filter for SPY:

Price momentum: Only hold equities when SPY is above its 200-day SMA (trend filter — stay out during downtrends).
Macro regime (yield curve): Only hold equities when the 10Y-2Y Treasury spread (from FRED) is above -0.10% — i.e., avoid holding during deep yield-curve inversions.
Core logic: A yield curve inversion (10Y < 2Y) historically precedes recessions by 6–18 months. By combining this inversion filter with the 200-day trend filter, the strategy aims to reduce equity exposure during the worst drawdown windows while keeping most of the upside during expansion phases.

Both signals must be true simultaneously to go long. Transaction costs of 0.05% per trade are applied.
